One Day One Question - private method

ODOQ - private method in ruby

Here's the short and the long of it. What private means in Ruby is a method cannot be called with an explicit receivers, e.g. someinstance.privatemethod(value). So even though the implicit receiver is self, in your example you explicitly use self so the private methods are not accessible.
